text: Tap at hill farmstead. Pours a hazy straw color with a large pure white head. Aroma is a combo of grassy and tropical hops. Thinner bodied, no alcohol present. I like the interplay of florals and tropicals, but overall this is not their top tier stuff.

Sample @ CBC Boston, 2016. Somewhat hazy golden pour with a small white head. Lovely, bright, expressive nose. Citrus pith. Some stone fruit. Light floral hoppiness. Crisp and easy drinking. Some general mineral. A touch gristy. Still quite clean and effortless. Very nice.

Draft pour on tap at Blind Tiger (New York City, NY). Slightly more mellow nose, a bit ifcmosaic allure. Juicy hazy golden hue, a bitvdarker. Frothy whitish head. Good flavors, fruity, bitter, a bit tropical and green. Tasty, bitter finish and backend. Crusher.

Pours a cloudy bright bright orange with white head. A strong citrus, pine and tropical fruit aroma. A strong flavor of citrus hops, floral, tropical fruit, pine and light caramel malts. A balanced aftertaste of citrus, bitter hops and caramel malts.
Golden tap into a snifter glass. Very easy clean and easy to drink. Would be a fantastic summer and/or session beer.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. HFD #17 Mega wytrawne, bardzo dobry smak chmielowy, trochę zalegająca goryczka.

Draft at Milk and Hops-Chelsea. Hazy golden pour with a small white head and lots of coating, spotty lacework. Citrus and grassy aroma with some melon notes, and that classic HF yeast as well. Tastes clean and a little bitter. Fruit, yeast, and grass. Balanced. Nice crisp, dry finish. Clean, soft mouthfeel. Really quality.

Draught @ Alewife. Hazy pale yellow with small foamy off-white head, fresh lemon aroma, medium carbonation, medium bitter lemon peel taste, smooth body, well-balanced longish lemon finish. So refreshing and tasty.

Growler... Hazy straw-colored pour with yellow highlights and a fizzy, white collar. The aroma features tangerine and grapefruit accompanied by lesser notes of a females musky armpit - onion and garlic. Light-bodied with lazy carbonation. Sweet and bready malts take a back seat to rindy, tannic hops. The flavor is well-balanced, refreshing and bright. Theres lingering bitterness in the dry, sandpapery finish. Bottle courtesy of ctipping!
Draft at Alewife. Hazy blonde pour. Fine dry APA with notes of melon, citrus, and resin. Aroma is lovely as expected. Very good.
Light hazy color and delicate on the palate, some hay and funk but so easy drinking. A bit of nice hop on the finish, too.
On tap at The Pony Bar - 10th Ave. Nice golden hazy body with medium head. Nose is hops, fruits, some citrus. Taste similar of hops, citrus. Well-balanced. Citrus in the finish. Good stuff.
Growler. Pours a very hazy cloudy yellow with a white head. Big juicy and dank hop notes. Lots of grapefruit. Overall deliciousness.

May 12, 2016. On tap at Hill Farmstead day at Warpigs. .
Hazy yellow with a small creamy white head. Aroma is hoppy, fruity and dank with mango, pineapple, peach, tangerine, grapefruit, grass and hints of grain. Taste is light sweet, dank and fruity, light to medium bitter. Medium bodied, smooth texture, soft to average carbonation. Finish is light smooth bitterness with grass, citrus pith and chives, light sweet juicy tropical fruits. 
Dank, juicy and very drinkable.

Tap. Doc Ponds, Stowe, VT. Very hazy, yellow gold. Thin, sticky, white head. Nose has pithy citrus. Lots of orange and sweet lemon. Notes of nectarine and a little white grape. Clean and dry malt background. Taste is soft, juicy, citrus rind bitter. Light dryness. Soft, juicy mouthfeel. Light bitter finish. Smashable.
Growler, this is how all IPAs should taste, damn this is good. Tons of citrus, tropical and grapefruit flavors. Moderate bitterness, thick and sticky. LOVE IT.

Growler.
Pours hazy blond with medium white head. Good lacing. Aroma is of citrus, fruits, garlic? Taste is of citrus, malt, garlic, bitterness. Palate: Light body, soft-medium carbonation. Overall: Citrus. Good, fresh.
drier good pale aroma. orange colour. good mouthfeel. on tap prohibition pig.

Style et résumé: APA du nord-est. 
Comment: Dégustation Manseau Automne 2016, Merci Tommy et les autres.
Portrait:  Une bière jaune trouble, rien de surprenant. Un nez de citron, agrumes et savon à vaisselles. Une bouche un peu mince, piquante, légèrement acide sur des saveurs dagrumes et de citron. Une réussite.
Note:  7+/10

Growler 2L, bottle share. Couleur jaune paille trouble, mousse blanche onctueuse laissant une belle dentelle. Arôme de pomélo, houblon résineux, malt pâle, signature HF. Goût de houblon résineux, malt pâle, amertume contenue. Carbonatation moyenne-faible, corps moyen, texture ample.

Beaucoup de beauté houblonnée dans cette pale ale. Citra, fruits et herbes, fleurs et foresterie, choses vertes fraîches et séchées. Encore une fois, extrême buvabilité. Corps bien structuré, comme toujours. Finale très fraîche.

Growler. Robe jaune paille trouble à la HF. Mince voile de mousse. Arômes de fruits tropicaux frais, malt, biscuits et gazon. En bouche, saveurs plus maltées et croquantes, quelques agrumes éparpillés avec présence de mangue et pamplemousse. Finale amère et douce de zeste de citron et orange pressées. Texture plutôt onctueuse et corps mince.

Draft pour at the source. The beer is a hazy yellow with a white head of foam. The aroma has dry grass, some juicy citrus. Kind of like an unripened orange. Medium body and medium to high carbonation. Soft, velvety mouthfeel.

[Draught at Blind Tiger, NYC, Sep. 22] Pours a cloudy yellow-gold with an average size semi-lasting frothy white head. Minimal lacing. Aroma (7+) of hops first, hempy and citrusy, backed by bready malt. Nice flavour follows the aroma, hempy and citrusy, with tropical fruit, bready malt and a long bitter finish. Medium bodied. A great Pale Ale.

Drank on tap (12 oz) at Blind Tiger Ale House in Manhattan on September 23, 2016. Hazy white gold, small head. Fresh crip hoppy citrus aroma, light spruce notes. The taste is the same, quite zesty, hoppy green bitterness. Good summer ale, even in the fall!
From tap at Warpigs. Hazy golden colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of fruit, peach, citrus, malt and hops.
Sample at CBC Boston. Comes a hazy pale gold with a decent white head. Aroma of citrus and tropical. Taste is grapefruit, orange, tropical fruits, and malt. Very good.

Tap into shotglass showing moderately filtered honey yellow with half a finger of clean white foam. 

The nose shows a lot of mango and guava. Very juicy and clean. 

The palate is light bodied and well carbonated. Flavors of clean guava with lighter notes of pear and kiwi. Light bitterness on the finish.

On tap @ Hill Farmstead. Crushed another growler on top of Camels Hump. Cloudy bright golden beer with a white head. Mild to moderate bitterness on this. Lots of grapefruit, orange, and spicy hop aromas and flavors to this. Definitely a touch of the Mosaic dank, but get a bunch of that blueberry fruitiness. Some fresh flowers, dried herbs, and tropical fruits like pineapple and mango. Really a nice beer.
Fat på CBC 2016. Smak och doft av citrus, citron, grapefrukt, granskott och passionsfrukt. Torr, frisk, lagom sötma, fruktig, beska med smak av granskott och tall. Riktigt gott!

One of my favorite pale ales. Pours from growler into tulip glass a cloudy pale yellow color with moderate white head. Aroma is tropical fruit, orange floral, light scallion, and cracker. Taste is bursting with juicy tropical fruits with a light touch of bitterness that is nice to balance things a bit. Reminiscent of Tree House Lights On another one of my favorite pale ales.

Tasting at MattsBlond color, a bit too cloudy, but Matt always shakes the bottles like a cocktail blender. Plenty of hop goodness, citrus zest, piney hops. Very dry mouthfeel, the malt is a bit absent, but the hopping is excellent, zesty, and pungent in the final.Very nice.
Growler pour fresh from the mail. Lovely hazy yellow. Aroma of citrus. Citrus, hint of grass on a nice pale ale base. Light and fresh feeling.
Growler - Grassy, skunk and citrus. Cloudy gold with a small white head. Nice hoppy skunk and citrys with a touch peel. Solid.
Pours a hazy yellow colour with an off-white head. Big mango and citrus aroma, very fruit forward. Fruity hop flavour with balancing bitterness. A world class pale ale.

Hazy tan. Has a lovely hoppy nose full of orange, grapefruity and rambutan. Soft pale malts, rich bitterness, light orangey, pithy, grapefruit. Very fresh. Delicious. Very drinkable, just an excellent pale ale.

750mL growler, sent from yourilevesque (thanks a lot, Youri), pours a cloudy golden with a small white head. Aroma is super fresh, with loads of fresh floral hoppiness, dough and biscuity malt. Flavour is extremely fresh, with loads of gentle floral hopping, a touch of resins, and soft doughy malts. No astringency on the finish, just wonderful dryness, pillowy doughyness and light hops. Phenomenal stuff.

(On tap @ Warpigs HF Day, Copenhagen, May 12 2016) Pours hazy yellow gold with an average-sized tight white cap. Aroma juicy peach, pineapple, grapefruit, mango, light floral, malts quite dry but with a bit of cracker/bread. Flavour has a dry malt body with juicy sweet impression from the hops; peach, pineapple, citrus pith. Very light dank character. Subtle biscuit. Light to moderate bitterness in the finish and aftertaste. Fairly light body, soft smooth carbonation. Very drinkable, juicy but not a fruit bomb, super balance.

Hazy yellow colour, mediumsized white head. Aroma is earth, some spruce, wooden and some mild earthy and mild toffeeish notes. Flavour is floral, fruity, some nectar and mild toffeeish and wooden notes to it.

On tap at the brewery on a warm August summer day. Your basic yellow pour with a modest head and better clarity than some of their unfiltered beers. Toasted bread with grassy and floral hops on the nose. A touch of herbal character. Light and refreshing body. Good hop bitterness mingling with the otherwise clean and crisp character.
Draft. A hazy yellow beer with a white head. The aroma has notes of straw, hops, and malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of spices, straw, and hops, leading to a bitter finish.

750ml growler in a tulip. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of citrusy and piney/lightly resinous hops, some pale malts, and light dough. Flavor exactly what Id expect from a HF pale with these hops - nice hoppiness that doesnt have too much mosaic presence. Average texture. Another good HF beer.

Draft. Juice aroma off the charts. Pours murky yellow thin thin white head that lingers. Complex light hop flavors. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hey look, another awesome HF Pale Ale! Poured into a sample glass at the brewery, pours clear golden with a small white head. Aroma of citrus, mango, slight resin. Taste is citrus and tropical, slight resin on the back end of the sip, and a very dry finish. Great beer.
Sample @ Hill Farmstead Tap Takeover, Warpigs. Hazy yellow body with a small white head. Hops, pine, citrus, grapefruit, fruity. Dry and crisp.

CBC 2016 Blue session. Hazy golden body with a creamy white head. Aroma is light malty with a strong hop presence; grapefruit, orange, mango. Taste is zesty and fruity with a nice bitterness, dominated by the same fruits. Dry clean hoppy finish. A tremendous pale ale, lovey!

Pours thick, unclear golden orange with a nice, creamy white head. Divine aroma brings a combo of those 3 delicious hops with springy herbs. Flavors of tangy, juicy orange zest and with a smooth, not quite a bite, but a bite of juicy hops that you want (if that makes sense!).

Draft at Armsby Abbey. Pours a bright, hazy, golden yellow with a fluffy white head. Aromas of citrus and bready malts. Flavor was lemon, grapefruit, slight onion, bready malts. Light bodied, sticky texture, soft carbonation, easy finish. Very easy drinking light hoppy pale.
On tap at Black Back Pub, Waterbury. Floral tropical aroma. Taste of juicy citrus fruits and floral notes. Another fantastic APA from HF.
Hazy golden pour, frothy white head. Nose is citrus, onion, some pickle. Taste is spicy hops, fresh water, pickle, some citrus. Very bitter on the finish, somewhat chalky.

Draft. Large white head atop murky light amber body. Aroma is moderately sweet, grapefruit, some pineapple, grapefruit rind, grape. Taste is moderately sweet, grapefruit, some pineapple, light grape, tangerine. Light-medium, light acidity, effervescence.

Growler in NH. Pours hazy gold with a creamy, white head. Pithy citrus in the aroma, dry pale bread, peach. Lightly sweet, dry, with more peach, some biscuit. Light bodied with average, massaging carbonation. Continuing dryness in the finish, with more pithy citrus, lemon rind, light grapefruit, pale malts. Very drinkable gear.

Growler from brewery. Pours slightly hazy with some foamy head and lots of lacing. Nose is fruity and floral. Flavours are floral, some grapefruit, some light peppery spice, some grain, some citrus. Taste light/medium bitter, light sweet. Medium body medium carbonation and some lasting bitterness.

Draught @ [ Hill Farmsted Tape Take Over ] - Warpigs Brewpub, Flaesketorvet 24, DK-1711 Copenhagen, Denmark. [ As Hill Farmstead Sumner ].Unclear light to medium yellow color with a average, frothy - creamy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, moderate to light light heavy hoppy, tropical fruit, pineapple. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, pineapple, fruity, tropcical fruit, dry. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. Very nice balanced beer ;D [20160512]

Growler thanks to Steve, share on 6/11/16. After hearing so much about this brewery, I was a little underwhelmed by this. Cloudy, pale golden body, small wispy head. Floral, herbal, spicy notes in the aroma (for an APA?)Taste also favors lighter savory essences, decent beer, but not up to the hype.

Draft @ Warpigs Brewpub, Copenhagen. Pours a hazy yellow golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity peachy hoppy citrus aroma. Fruity malty peachy hoppy citrus flavor. Has a fruity malty citrus hoppy peachy finish.

Growler thanks to Steve. My long awaited first beer from HF pours out a hazy yellow golden color with a bit of white head. Floral hop aroma, fruity, a little malty. Fresh floral and citrus hop flavors, mild bitterness and lightly sweet.

On draft at Beer Belly in Albany. The pour is a foggy golden yellow with a thick ring of white head that falls down, leaving some good lace. The aroma is pretty good. There is a lot of juicy hop to this right up front. Its got lemongrass and a nice citrus zest that kind of ties it all together. The citrus does a good job of balancing the hops. No malt is detected, which I like. The flavor is good for sure. There is a bright citrus bursting onto the palate. A lightly bittering hop moves through with a bit of a leafiness. The mouth feel is a little thick, but well carbonated with a lingeringly citrus dominated, slightly bitter hop aftertaste. This is a good one!

Flight at The Belly with koleminer20. Aroma is tropical fruit, juicy, pine, good. Appearance is golden, hazy, white head. Taste is juicy, troical fruit, pine, great. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light carbonation, wonderful fruit pine aftertaste. Overall, this a knockout.
Growler thanks to Steve. Pours out cloudy straw color topped with a small head. Nose is nice floral perfume notes some spice. Taste is more of the floral perfume hops a nice spice and some bread.

Pours a hazy yellow with a frothy, white head. Copious, sticky lacing. Nose is fruit, grass, and pine, with notes of biscuit. Taste is predominately bitter. Mouthfeel is dry; the finish slightly astringent. Medium body. Lively carbonation. Excellent offering.
on tap chiara torbida schiuma media discreto luppolato resinoso con note agrumate buona seccha buon amaro non invadente finale frutta tropicale

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar Aarhus. Pours hazy yellow with a medium white head. Aroma is dank hoppy, tropical fruits, passion fruit, pineapple, stone fruits, citrussy. Taste is juicy hoppy, citrussy, pineapple, mango, dank.
Pony w APec 5.29.16. Light hazy yellow with fresh floral and earthy hops all over nose and palate. Easy to crush and floral all the way down, like sucking down a vine. Great.

On tap at Milk & Hops. Pours a bright lightly hazed yellow orange, white head. Aroma is papaya, mango, tangerine, grass, orange joooose. Flavor is juicy citrus, papaya, some bitter citrus and grapefruit rind, light pine. Super juicy APA, crushable and flavorful... Awesome.

Growler thanks to Charles. Pours a cloudy gold with small off white head thst lasts. The aroma is tropical fruit mango and tangerine, floral. Medium mouth, light pine, mango, nice light bitterness, crushable, really nice.

duft: citrus lime frugtig 
smag: citrus lime lidt frisk sødme kant af malt og vådt korn
[5/12/16] Draught at Warpigs in Copenhagen. Cloudy yellow. Big fruity hops aroma, juicy, tropical. Dry flavor with tropical fruity hops, a bit oniony. Very good and refreshing.

Tap. Cloudy golden body with a small lacing, white head. Aroma of citrus, tropical fruit, apricot and caramel notes. Slightly sweet flavor that ends up dry and bitter. Light to medium bodied. warery to oily texture and soft carbonation. An excellent APA. 🌟🌟🌟

Tap @ Mikkeller Aarhus. Pours Pours unclear yellow with a white head. Aroma of pineapple, dank hop pallets, tropic fruits, citrus papaya and lemon zest. The taste is juicy with notes of citrus, tropical fruits, fresh dank hops and a smooth mouthfeel which makes this very drinkable like most other HF hoppy servings.
Tap @ mikkeller Aarhus. Aroma of citrus and piney hops. Hazy yellow with lasting white head. Taste is moderate bitter and light sweet. Medium+ body, smooth oily feel, citrus bitter finish.
Sample @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016 Blue session 20160513. Hoppy and fruity, citrusy and peachy. The finish is dry, bitter and fruity.

Keg @ WarPigs. Pours hazy vibrant deep yellow with a frothy white head that leaves some thick sticky lacing on the glass while dissipating. Smell is slightly fruity and grassy with crackers, grapefruit juice, mango, pineapple, star fruit, freshly cut grass, pine needles, minerals and lemon zest. Taste is bitter, slighty fruity and grassy. Mouthfeel is dry, slightly astringent and medium bodied. Finish is bitter with freshly cut grass, chives and hints of tropical fruits. Bit heavy on the grass but fresh and enjoyable.

Draught @ Hill Farmstead Day - Warpigs Brewpub, København
Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, citrus, grape, lemon, grass and pine needles. Taste is light to medium sweet and medium bitter with a long citrus, grape, grassy and piney finish. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.
appear cloudy pale with a fine white head. light piny, light lemon, and grape. taste light bitter. medium bodies light creamy, average carbonation. light bitter finish.
Growler - pours yellow white head - nose/taste of white pepper, hop, citrus and light toast malt - med body
Tap at farmhouse in Burlington with commonmac and rosskyle and samadouche. Cloudy yellow orange with medium white head. Subtle aroma. Fresh, crisp. Heavy citrus, a bit of tang. Good body. Well done.
Sample @ CBC16, Copenhagen. Blue session. Light cloudy pour with a small frothy head. Tons of citrusy notes, light pine, stone fruits with a medium bitter finish.

Draft from a keg. Totally turbid bright yellow, carbonation is perfect. Aroma is grassy, scallion hints, maybe the lightest note of pine. 
Flavor is bold and delicate at the same time. Citrus is a tad more forward in the flavor but grassy mosaic hits my palate more. Mouthfeel has the signature light airy mouthfeel that that magic well water has. World class, yet again. So, so drinkable.
Tap @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration, 2016. Pours Hazy golden with a white head. Tropical hops. Juicy and dry. Fresh!

750mL growler filled 4/29/16 and drunk 5/9/16.Big white head, nicely retained, tops this fairly hazy copper-blonde beer.Not at all what I was expecting! Not that I really had any good reason to expect a big juice bomb but this is anything but. Perfume for days, mimicking honeysuckle, with delicate dots of honey and very light biscuit notes. Seems to mostly driven by citra, which are here done better than most, with no cat (not even the good cat) and little, if any, dustiness or scallion. Mild mango character and bits of dry nectarine from the other two hops but absolutely pine free. Its great when simcoe is done right. Anyhow, I just sat and sniffed my glass for 5 minutes or so. Uncannily honeysuckle-aromatics are delightful and linger delicately.Perfect texture/carbonation, as always, with no alcohol/flaw nor surplus of bitterness. Dry, with some dextrine or wheat-like chewiness to it with soft honey notes emerging more and more with warming and lots of lemon, light pineapple and grapefruit lingering wonderfully. Doesnt even matter if they got the exact hop aromatics/flavors they wanted; the yeast, water and malt bring up the slack easily.  God damn. HF, TH and Trillium are legit legalized crack.

Tap @ Warpigs. Hazy dark yellow with white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hops, tropical fruit, pine and earthy. Flavour is malt, fruit, hops, grapefruit, pine, tropical fruit, little dry, little sweet and medium bitter.

Growler from HF. Pours a deep cloudy gold with a medium sized white head. Aroma of grapefruit, orange, hops and light funk. Taste of orange, grapefruit and hops. Very crisp and refreshing. Another gem from HF.

From tap at Warpigs, Copenhagen. Hazy yellow color with white head. Aroma is light malty and hoppy, floral, grassy, light pine, citrusy fruity, orange, grapefruit. Sweet and bitter like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Fat på CBC-16. Det här var mitt första smakprov på festivalen efter 8 månaders väntan och 3 köer på vägen in så betyget speglar väl i någon mån detta för jag var lyrisk efter smakprovet. Precis så här ska en modern APA smaka. Massor av juicig fruktiget i både doft och smak, lätt kropp, torr avslutning med en måttlig beska. Rent, välbalanserat och så mycket fruktighet. Mango, ananas, passionsfrukt, lichie, papaya och en hel del torr och frisk citrus. Den bästa APAn jag druckit och säkert den bästa i hela universum iaf fall i det ögonblicket.
On tap at CBC 2016. Pale yellow with a white head. Brett, lemons, and perfumey-flowery hops.

On tap at WarPigs Brewpub, Hill Farmstead Day. Kindly shared by KimJohansen. Crocheted lacing from a tiny white head. Pale golden body, misty. Aroma of pineapple and apricot. Fruity flavours of orange and pineapple. Fruity bitterness to the ending. Medium bodied with fine drinkability (Copenhagen 12.05.2016).

Aroma and taste is a mix of tropical and citrus fruits, pale malt, tangerine, mango, grapefruit, peachy, lemon, juicy and highly quaffable. Lovely stuff.
CBC Blue Session. Pours hazy yellow with white head. Fruity, hoppy aroma with citrus, mango, pineapple and lychee. Medium bitter taste with same fruitiness and hint of pine and hay. Bitter finish.

Sample at CBC 2016. 

Hazy yellow with a white head. Fresh and hoppy with pineapple, mango, grapefruit and some hay. Balanced and medium bitter. The finish was fairly dry. A solid one.

Draught sample at CBC 2016, Blue session. Hazy, golden colour with a creamy, white head. Fruity aroma with zesty citrus fruits, grape, oranges and sweet, exotic fruits. Very fresh. Taste is bitter. Medium body. Long lasting, dry and bitter with with an overload of citrus fruits. World class APA. Very refreshing.

Draught @ Warpigs, Copenhagen. Pours hazy yellow with a creamy white head. Aorma of light malt, grass, rich fruity hops, pineapple, mango, sweet citrus, orange, grapefruit. Flavor is malt, grassy, rich fruit, pineapple, peach, mango, citrus. Medium body, average carbonation, dry and bitter finish. Could drink loads of this. 120516

Sample at Warpigs during Hill Farmstead Day 2016. Hazy golden beer with a nice offwhite head. Hoppy pine aroma, citrus, grapes, floral, some grapes. Hoppy pine flavor, citrus, grapes, floral notes, oranges, some pine apples. Really nice

(on tap @ CBC 2016) If I cant have Susan I can always have Sumner - the overlooked beer at the CBCs blue session since this had been poured already the day before during the Warpigs HF tap takeover. Poured into a CBC tulip reveals a hazy golden body with one finger of white head that sticks around and leaves beautiful lace. Aroma has notes of peach, mango and pineapple juice and perhaps a hint of spruce. Mouthfeel shows oily texture, medium carbonation, a medium to light body and a relatively crisp, dry and flavourful finish. Flavour follows the nose with moderate tropical fruite and subdued bitterness. I could easily drink 40 times as much as the 5 cl offered but the key lies in moderation I suppose. Girlfriend says: "Its very hoppy. Slightly watery. One-dimensional. There is nothing coming after it. Its bitter and dry and thats it." (having spent an evening on fruit-infused spontaneous fermentation beers and peanut butter lactose stouts)

Draught at Proletariat nyc. Hazy amber with a big white head. Fresh citrus and a little bit of blueberries. Dry and bitter, hoppy with lemon zest. Medium body, quite fizzy, and dry and a little leafy aftertaste.

Tap at CBC. Pours pale cloudy golden. Lightly hopped aroma. Citrus, pine, grapefruit. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Sample @ CBC-16, Copenhagen 13/5-16. Fruity and hoppy with citrus and grapefruit, fresh. The finish is dry and bitter.
Pours hazy yellow with a low white head. Aromas of grapefruit, mango, peach, resin. Taste is fruity and floral with a nice bitterness. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation.

Pours hazy yellow with low white head 
Aromas of citrusy fruits, grass, caramel, pine 
Taste very nice of citrusy fruits; mango, resin, pine

Draught @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016. Hazy deep hay yellow liquid with medium white head. Aroma of citrus, tangerine, weed, flowers, mango and light grain. Taste is almost dry and light to medium bitter with notes of mango, tangerine, grain and flowers. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Nice!

UPDATED: MAY 13, 2016 Draught @ CBC 2016, Copenhagen. Pours yellowish with a smooth foamy head. Aroma of fresh juicy fruits, zesty grapefruit, citrus and tropical notes. Taste is smooth, juicy and hoppy with some citrus, grapefruit and grass. Finish is juicy and fresh hoppy with some zesty fruits. Great.
Tap at CBC2016, Copenhagen. Colour is cloudy golden with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Fruits, citrus, grape, hops and malts.

On tap at Parker Pie. A nice, refreshing light pale ale that has some great hop smell, but not a lot more going on. It was a bit too bitter for my palate, too. Nothing at all wrong with it, but not quite at the dizzying heights of some of the other Hill stuff out there.
Tap at war pigs.. Light yellow Amber... Thin white lacing.. Soft zezty fruits nose.. Tart orange.. Juicy bitter orange peel
Tap @Warpigs. Hazy yellow, white head. Aroma has lemon and green grapes. Floral. Lemon, grapefruit flavour. Some sweetness. Nicely refreshing.
Cloudy light yellow. Very light Hay/grass/wheat on the nose. Taste follows nose quite well. Nice!

Draught. Golden coloured. Unclear. Dense light beige head. Sroma. Citrus, fruits, sweetness, flowers. Flavour. Herbs flowers, citrus, some sweetness. Medium to full bodied. Ends floral bitter. Nice

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap @ Warpigs, tap take over. Murky golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and moderate hoppy - citrus. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 120516
Tap@ warpigs. Pours cloudy golden with a thick white head. Minerals, fruity, floral aroma, citrus. Fairly light. Citrusy, floral, hoppy flavors. Good.
From tap. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is peachy and grapefruity. Smooth fruity and crisp hoppy. Bitter md smooth fruity finish.

Fruity nose, bit cream malty, yellow fruity. Med bodied, flavourful, just a little thin tho. Finishes clean, dryish. Really wasy, soft creamy ale.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
UPDATED: MAY 12, 2016 Cloudy yellow with a lasting white head. Aroma of straw, fresh grain, citrus and pineapple. Dry citrus hoppy flavour on a nice, clean malty background

Tap wapigs. Pours cloudy light orange with a white head. Aroma of grape, hoppy, tangerine, citrus, malty, peachy. Taste is rather sweet, rather bitter, juicy. Nice balance. Rather bitter and dry apa. Nice.
Growler. Cloudy yellow pour with a white head. Lemon aromas. Big grassy hop notes. Good body and mouthfeel.

750 mL growler. Hazy pale orange. Nice white head. Smell has sweet orange hops up front and a strong garlic/onion backdrop. Taste is orange up front and immediately has the garlic bite. A little bit of sweet pale malt. Very little bitterness. Medium light body. Low carbonation. Delicious, as always.

UPDATED: AUG 19, 2016 Many celebratory pints after the Series 79. Pours a bright, murky golden orange body with thick white lacing. Fresh dry citrus on the nose. Mouthfeel is dry, medium bodied and super sessionable. Notes of dry lemon, bitter grapefruit, juicy pomelo, citrus fruit puree and crisp hop profile.

On tap at The Blackback Pub, Waterbury, VT. 
This was poured into a tulip. 
The appearance was a hazy burnt orange color with a slim fingers worth of a bar pours kind of head. Adequate lacing sticks and then slides after quick dissipation of the head.
The smell had a sweet orange juice bitterness with subtle zest, extra citrus, light grassy, somewhat grapefruit pulp and rind blending for full effect. 
The taste was a balanced bitter to sweet citrus / grapefruit bitter rind. Citrus full in effect in the aftertaste and bitter finish. 
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with a fairly decent sessionability about it. Carbonation runs smooth and somewhat light.
Overall, I liked this one. Would definitely have again.

On draft @ the Blue Stone, Pours a hazy dull yellow/gold with an of-white head. The smell is huge citrus, toasted grain, grapefruit. The taste is elegant citrus, not too sharp but flavorful ending dry and crisp. Light in body with fine carbonation. Totally damn drinkable!

from growler shared by mathieuc, many thanks bro! hazy lightly glowing pale golden with a small white cap offering minimal retention and lacing. bright fresh tropical juices, passionfruit, citrus, some tender onions and pickled garlic; pale lean maltiness - very fruity though; clean yeast action. moderately low carbonation, light body - slightly watery; drying yet balanced citrusy finish. not their juiciest with a fairly light body. almost qualifies with a highly quaffable/sessionable hoppy pale ale.

Draft to snifter at Blackback Pub. Looks good; a slightly hazy lemony gold with white head. Smells of bitter, piney, and fruity hops with a mildly bittersweet backbone. Tastes like it smells with a pleasant medium-light to medium-bodied mouthfeel. Enjoyable, and super-sessionable.

On tap at Tørst. Pours a hazy straw gold with a foamy whitehead. It has a nice aroma of citrus and passion fruit with a little grass. The flavor has the same profile with a slightly bitter finish over a medium body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

4 days old growler. Pours a really hazy and almost cloudy golden with a small white head that leaves nice lacing. Nose is of juicy fruits, pine, resin with light onion and garlic in the background. Taste is moderately bitter and juicy with some crispy cereals. More pine and tropical fruits. Body is on the light side (but not watery) and carbonation moderately high. Lightly sticky. Super drinkable. Assertive bitter finish but no harshness whatsoever. Du grand art!


P.S. It got more orange-forward as it warmed and even more enjoyable.

Growler from Barry, Pours cloudy golden with medium to large white head. Aroma is rock sweat, well water, and some honey lemon. Flavor is bitter and ashy lemon hop, pepper, oats and grain. Probably get the mosaic the most but it doesnt taste as good as last years mosaic crop. This is a great American pale overall but a little underwhelming for Hill and the palatable percentage. Its just slightly off, but still much better than 95 percent of the hoppy beers made.

Growler partagé chez Jonathan. Encore une magnifique Pale Ale signée Shaun. Cette bière qui à laveugle ne pourrait provenir dailleurs que de la colline vermontoise, ma gagné par son fabuleux bouquet olfactif sur une base de grains frais. À ce grain blond, des houblons fruités ajoutent une touche estivale et festive. Ça sent lété! Saveurs moins réjouissantes pour moi. Les houblons sont mi fruités, mi résineux. Saveurs de foin, de campagne, de vieille grange. En fait, cette bière mapparaît beaucoup plus aromatique que réellement savoureuse. Pour toute saveurs, au-delà dune présence de grains et de houblons pamplemoussés, le reste mapparaît manque de mordant. Une curieuse impression que ce que jai en bouche ne se résous sur rien, mis à part une Pale Ale quelque peu gazonneuse facile à boire.

750ml growler bought 2 days ago @Hill Farmstead. Aroma: wonderful aroma of peaches, oranges, pineapples and pines. App: hazy straw with a green tint, small white head, ok lacing. Taste and palate: light body, fruity but not much, maybe not enough giving the impression its watery, average carbonation, resinous but just not much, crisp light lingering bitter finish. Overall: well made apa. Taste is a bit of a let down after an awesome aroma like that. Could have taste a bit more so it lost a few points there. It could have been my best apa but failed at it because of it taste.

Growler (750 ml). Split 2-ways. Thanks to Didier for this growler! Hazy glowing yellow with a small easy to revive white head leaving some lacing. Aroma is super dank, lots of grass, citrus/lemon and mild spiciness. Taste of grass, dankness, lean maltiness, mild spicy presence, hints of citrus/lemon and mild to moderate bitterness. Medium body. Medium carbonation. Grassy finish. Another amazingly drinkable and refreshing American Pale Ale. Nice grassy hops features. Loved it.

Growler shared with Tom. Hazy pale yellow pour with thin lightly lacy white head. Aroma is really nice, so fruity, soft grassy notes, super hoppy but not aggressive at all, light dank notes, light lemon zest, so fruity. Taste is fruity, lightly bitter, super juicy, lemony flavor, so light and refreshing, soft honey notes. Palate is light bodied, smooth carbonation. Delicious.

Pours murky and dirty pale golden with low white head. Aroma of light pine, peach, mango, citrus. Taste is mild bitter with a light fruit sweetness before a lingering bitter finish. Light and smooth body with soft carbonation.

75CL Growler, consumed a day after filling

A - Beautiful hazy orange. A thin bubbly white head. Fades to a thin line

S - The nose is really great. This huge juicing orange aroma. Grapefruit, lemons, just yeah. Smells so damn good. 

T - Incredibly juicy. Dry, almost no sweetness until the end. Lots of orange juice in this one. Fresh orange zest. IBU seems low but its so full of flavor. This has a similar profile as if Walden & Susan were merged together into a dryer, juicier pale ale. 

M - Excellent mouthfeel, dry, spritzy, effervescent. 

O - This may be better than Susan to me. I really dont know. All I do know, Im getting more.

Great tropical citrus hop aroma. Taste adds in some piney resinous hops, body is light and refreshing but still full bodied. Feels ipa like vs pale ale. Very hoppy. But well made and a very good beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a bright orange with a thick white lacing. The aroma is grapefruit, orange and pine. The flavor is bitter and the palate is dry. Tons going on at 5%
Growler. Golden pour with white head. Herbal, citrus and grassy hop aromas. Citrus forward hop profile, light grassy hop tones.
Tap at ginger man. Hazy yellow beer. Small aromas of grass and herbal and floral. Tastes of grassy, apricots, melon, herbal, florals. Light bodied. Easy drinker and just decent

On tap at Black Back Pub. Hazy pale golden orange with lasting head and lace. Orange citrus aroma some spice. Scent of an orange San pelligrino. Mild peachy apricot sweetness with some grassiness. Citrus rind and spice bitterness with long weird spicy herbal finish. Light body soft carbo.
